Package cpsc2150.extendedCheckers.models

Interface ICheckerBoard

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbsCheckerBoard, CheckerBoard, CheckerBoardMem
public interface ICheckerBoard
The interface for the CheckerBoard. This interface contains methods required to manipulate and query the state of the checkerboard.

  • Method Details

    • placePiece

      void placePiece(BoardPosition pos, char player)
      Places a player's piece on the board at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      pos - a position on the checkerboard
      player - the player's piece character

    • whatsAtPos

      char whatsAtPos(BoardPosition pos)
      Gets the piece given at the specific board position.
      Parameters:
      pos - the position on the board to check.
      Returns:
      The character piece at that position or EMPTY_POS if nothing's there.

    • getViableDirections

      HashMap<Character,ArrayList<DirectionEnum>> getViableDirections()
      Returns the viable movement directions for each player's pieces on the board
      Returns:
      A hashmap where the keys are piece characters and the values are lists of viable direction enums for that piece.

    • getPieceCounts

      HashMap<Character,Integer> getPieceCounts()
      Retrieves a mapping of each player to their respective count of pieces remaining on the board.
      Returns:
      The HashMap containing the amount of pieces each player has on the board.

    • getRowNum

      int getRowNum()
      Gets the number of rows on the board.
      Returns:
      The constant ROW_NUM

    • getColNum

      int getColNum()
      Gets the number of columns on the board.
      Returns:
      The constant COL_NUM

    • addViableDirections

      default void addViableDirections(char player, DirectionEnum dir)
      Maps a players move to a legal direction.
      Parameters:
      player - as a character that is representing the player's piece to which will map the direction added.
      dir - as a DirectionEnum in which the player's piece is allowed to move during their turn.

    • playerLostPieces

      default void playerLostPieces(int numPieces, char player, HashMap<Character,Integer> pieceCounts)
      Removes pieces from a player's count after it's jumped.
      Parameters:
      numPieces - as an int, the number of pieces the player has lost. This number must be positive.
      player - as a char representing the player whose pieces are being decreased.
      pieceCounts - as a HashMap, mapping from player characters to their respective counts of pieces remaining on the board.

    • checkPlayerWin

      default boolean checkPlayerWin(Character player)
      Checks to see if the player won the game.
      Parameters:
      player - as a Character to see whoever won.
      Returns:
      true if the player won the game. The player wins if all the pieces one the board belong to them. False otherwise.

    • crownPiece

      default void crownPiece(BoardPosition posOfPlayer)
      Kings a piece when it reaches the opposite end of the board.
      Parameters:
      posOfPlayer - the board position of the piece to be crowned.

    • movePiece

      default BoardPosition movePiece(BoardPosition startingPos, DirectionEnum dir)
      Moves a piece on the board.
      Parameters:
      startingPos - current position of the piece to be moved.
      dir - direction as a DirectionEnum in which to move the piece.
      Returns:
      The new position of piece after attempting the move, which may be the same as the starting position if the move was not valid.

    • jumpPiece

      default BoardPosition jumpPiece(BoardPosition startingPos, DirectionEnum dir)
      Moves a piece by jumping the opponent's piece.
      Parameters:
      startingPos - starting position on the board
      dir - direction as a DirectionEnum
      Returns:
      The new position of the piece after the jump, or original position if the jump is invalid.

    • scanSurroundingPositions

      default HashMap<DirectionEnum,Character> scanSurroundingPositions(BoardPosition startingPos)
      Scans the surrounding area and returns pieces in their given positions and identifies the pieces in each direction
      Parameters:
      startingPos - a piece's starting position on the board.
      Returns:
      A HashMap mapping each DirectionEnum to their char piece in that direction from startingPos or EMPTY_POS if the position is unoccupied.

    • getDirection

      static BoardPosition getDirection(DirectionEnum dir)
      Gets a BoardPosition offset for a direction
      Parameters:
      dir - as a DirectionEnum.
      Returns:
      a BoardPostion representing the offset for moving one space in the given direction specified by dir.
